content: That error message has nothing to do with the full name. Thunderbird is unable to login at the server. It doesn't use the Full Name provided to login at the server.

content: macOS Ventura 13.5.2 Thunderbird 115.2.3 (64-bit) Connecting to O365 Exchange outlook.office365.com
creator: r.burrowes

content:
You need to update your account's SMTP settings as follows:

Server Name = smtp.office365.com Port = 587 Connection security = STARTTLS Authentication method = Normal Password

Then, using a browser, sign in to your Microsoft account and generate an app password. It is that app password that you will use when Thunderbird asks for a password when you send mail. Your regular password will NOT work with Normal Password Authentication method, because Microsoft has stopped supporting basic authentication using your MS account's regular password on its MS (Office) 365 platform that powers your msn email service.
creator: stancestans

content: This does partially solve the problem. When I click the Choose button as discribed above, I see only one email option. There is no up-down-arrow to scroll to other email addresses. Only when you hover the mouse over the up-down-arrow location in te window you see the arrows and you can scroll through all the email addresses. Enable the desired email address does not solve the problem. Only when you extend the selected email address and enable all the boxes then it will work. You have to repeat this procedure the for all other boxes which are not populated like wastbin, unwanted email, etc.
creator: henk-firefox

content: Turn off the Unified Folders view and turn it back on. If that alone doesn't fix it, right-click the Sent unified folder, select Properties, then click the Choose button. Make sure the Sent folder for all accounts are ticked, then click OK then finally click Update. This should update the Sent Unified Folder.
creator: stancestans
